metadata.title: CVE-2020-11867 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Audacity through 2.3.3 saves temporary files to /var/tmp/audacity-$USER bydefault. After Audacity creates the temporary directory, it sets itspermissions to 755. Any user on the system can read and play the temporaryaudio .au files located there.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

audacity - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
audacity-data - 2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: audacity package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
